How I work

I enjoy working with found materials, such as slate, metal or painting on wood where I follow the grain pattern to find a new world to inhabit visually. I do paint on canvas, but I find a blank white canvas a little daunting. The texture of an alternative surface like wood will give hints of the forms I go on to create.

I draw on the myriad of patterns found within nature, frequently using these as abstract shapes for decorative effect and experimental mark making. I like to create fantasy scenes with the themes of the life cycle and the links between all living things from microscopic creatures to mountains or jungles.

I often start off with little idea of what I will come out with and the artwork reveals itself to me as I continue. I find this a more intuitive way to work rather than setting out a plan beforehand. Even with plans, the artwork invariably takes a new direction as I’m working so I may as well let go and let the process take me along with it.

Experience

  1. Elms Window Gallery, Leyton - solo show of selected paintings, 20 Aug - 9 Sept, Elms Window Gallery
    - June, E17 Art Trail, Walthamstow, Group exhibition showing new paintings; and
    - Walthamstow Life Drawing group exhibition at Orford House, Walthamstow, London
  2. A long hiatus from painting as a single parent
  3. Pastures Youth Centre, Leyton - Ten day workshop with young people painting a mural for the centre
  4. Changing Room Gallery (now Winns Gallery), Lloyd Park, Walthamstow, London, ‘Any Colour as Long as it’s Green’, Friends of the Earth exhibition, painting shown
  5. - Stoke Newington Festival, June, with The Others venue, sculpture and paintings shown
    - 'Climate of Change', Union street, SE1 curated by londonart.co.uk, sponsored by ASC Studios, mixed media photography and light installations of mine shown
  6. - ‘Uplift and Inspire, An Adbusters Intervention’, an independent exhibition event by artists on the District and Circle Lines. ‘Metabolic’, a collaboration between myself (photograph) and Paul Ibram (poem) was included in the show. Watch the short film about it here. The video quality is not great but it shows the event.
    - Stoke Newington Festival with The Others venue, paintings shown
  7. - Islington Contemporary Art and Design Fair, Candid Arts Trust, March - painting, photography and mixed media photography
    - Group exhibition - The Others, Stoke Newington, October
  8. Ickenox Group exhibition, Dray Walk Gallery, Brick Lane, London
  9. Independent Group Exhibition, Marble Arch, London
  10. The Drome Music Venue Southwark, London - paintings shown
  11. - Hoxton Arts Festival Group Exhibition of Painting, Photography, Prints, Sculpture, Poetry, Performance, Hoxton St, London - paintings shown; private sales of artwork
    - Public Mural painting, Metropolis Leisure Centre, Borehamwood, Hertfordshire
  12. Solo exhibition of paintings – Blue Room Café, Soho, London W1
  13. Freelance artist, mural painter, picture framer, interior design collaborations, private commissions, set painting for theatre and commercials - Johannesburg, Cape Town, London
  14. - 'Revue Noire – South Africa, Art and Literature', Dec 1993 – Feb 1994 No.11. Two photographs published in this edition on pg 5 of the publication - pg 7 of the pdf in this link
    - ICA Gallery, Newtown, Johannesburg - 'Drawing with Light – Photography Pushes the Limit'
    - Group Exhibition – V&A Waterfront, Cape Town
    - Freelance Photographer and Photographic Assistant
  15. - Photographs in “Outrage” Group Exhibition - painting, photography, performance, Johannesburg
    - Namibia Arts Association exhibition of artists of Southern Africa - photographs shown
  16. International Invitational Photography Exhibition, Benham Studio Gallery, Seattle, USA - two photographs selected for exhibition
  17. Thusong Community & Youth Centre, Alexandra, Johannesburg - Photography teacher
  18. BA Fine Art (Hons) University of Witwatersrand, Johannesburg, South Africa. Major in Photography & Printmaking
  19. Assistant to photographers, Shaw Studios, Brixton, Johannesburg;
    - Private mural painting commissions

    20. Paintings, drawings and photographs are held in private collections in UK, Canada, South Africa, USA, France and Germany.
